greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations of [n] with exactly k (possibly overlapping, cyclic wrap-around) occurrences of the consecutive step pattern UDU (U=up, D=down); triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=floor(n/2), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
example: T(2,1) = 2: 12, 21 (the two U's of UDU overlap).
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(u+o=0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))
mathematica: T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]]   [If[n < 2, 1, n*b[0, n - 1, 1]]];
T /@ Range[0, 12] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 19 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 02 2013
